## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1983691529.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 1667 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2148 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 640 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1667 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1508 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --711 type 2 SNPs
 --72 type 3 SNPs
 --783 total SNPs

 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1668 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1507 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 10 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1474068418.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0014/output_warnings

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 948622173.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------

 --excluded 2 SNPs, leaving 1632 SNPs for analysis
   --2 SNPs excluded for having no data

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 2051 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

2 warnings were generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0016/output_warnings] for details.

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 698954822.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 764 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 3179 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2362 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2075 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 170929534.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0045/output_warnings

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 377916154.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 2210 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 25 individuals
 --read 2200 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 450 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2210 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1750 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 2211 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1749 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------

        reference diplotypes: 25 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 10 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [162546619,162546619]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1079341413.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz -int 63769835 63769835 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 422 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 981 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0055/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 1570 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 680 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 981 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 890 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1001317240.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz -int 94741246 94741246 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0060/output_info_by_sample

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1466227791.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz -int 70429927 70429927 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --excluded 1 SNPs, leaving 2032 SNPs for analysis
   --1 SNPs excluded for having no data

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

1 warning was generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0063/output_warnings] for details.

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 2006029288.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz -int 115874566 115874566 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 802 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 1590 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0069/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2413 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 978 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1590 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1435 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 10 [Panel 2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================

======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1395901081.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz -int 107730976 107730976 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0097/output_warnings

The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1328805084.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz -int 40236043 40236043 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 500 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 1668 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0102/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 134 individuals
 --read 2363 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 841 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1668 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1522 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 1669 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1521 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

        reference diplotypes: 134 [Panel 1]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 178553445.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz -int 105329107 105329107 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 819 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --read 2175 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0113/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 35 individuals
 --read 2492 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2175 SNPs in Panel 2

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1921074762.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz -int 180412336 180412336 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0141/output_warnings

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance

  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1801520478.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz -int 123479639 123479639 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 757 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 10 individuals
 --read 1425 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0156/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 32 individuals
 --read 1646 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 525 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1425 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1121 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz -int 44059478 44059478 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EUR_500/HsInv0174/output_warnings
